subject: Re: [junit] Re: org.junit.runner.TextListener.run(Class, ...)
msgSnippet: Larry, Looks like the cookbook needs fixed.  Thanks for the pointer, David Saff
messageBody:
Larry,

Looks like the cookbook needs fixed. Thanks for the pointer,

David Saff

On 3/22/07, larryjbeckmann <larryjbeckmann@...> wrote:
> David,
> I would have to agree -- they do not seem to exist.
> In answer to your question the class in referenced in the JUnit Cookbook
> #TestRunner. <http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/cookbook/cookbook.htm>
> Thanks for confirming my perceptions.
> 1) It doesn't exist in the source.
> 2) That I should be looking at JUnitCore.
>
> regards,
> -Larry
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
> >
> > I don't believe this class and method exist. Where are they
> > recommended? You're better off looking at the run(...) methods of
> > JUnitCore. Good luck,
> >
> > David Saff
> >
> > alglobus wrote:
> > > Doesn't seem to be in the source distribution, or at least I can't
> > > find it. This is a problem since this is the recommended way to run
> > > tests. I presume it's in the jar file, but for our project, there is
> > > an absolute requirement that we have all of the source.
> > >
> > > Where is it?
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
